column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 107 of 124”
Table: 99
Capital Improvement Plan
DESCRIPTION
Acquisition of eight laptop computers capable of running
Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) Utility and related software
from a remote location with appropriate hook-ups for
Alternate PSAP during emergency situations.
Purchase and replace vehicles in the Animal Control Unit.
Animal Control functions are dependent on reliable and
serviceable vehicles to accomplish the Division's mission.
Construction of a new correctional facility to replace the
existing 26,500 square feet facility at 135 High Court Lane.
The new facility is planned as a direct supervision pod design
of approximately 60,000 square foot and would accommodate
500 beds with the ability to double-bunk. The Commonwealth
of Virginia will reimburse up to 25% of approved cost of
construction for a local jail.
This vehicle will replace a smaller and aging vehicle currently
in use. The new SUV or cargo van will employ an AWD
vehicle enabling the Forensic Specialist(s) to safely respond
to drowning scenes on beaches, scenes that occur during
inclement weather, or on location of rough terrain.
Equipment and training to implement digital document
imaging for Traffic Summonses, Accident Reports, F/I cards
and Arrest Sheets which are currently being physically stored
in the Records Unit.
Install diesel exhaust removal systems in all fire stations
which removes toxic diesel exhaust fumes generated by fire
trucks leaving and returning to fire apparatus bays.
Nineteen (19) streets have been identified as not having
adequate suppression water supply. Recommended that 10
fire hydrants be installed along with 9,281.8 feet of eight inch
water main, for the length thereof from Farm House Lane to
the northern end of the road.
Emerging requirement.
